description:
The Senior Manager of Government & Military Sales is responsible for all aspects of Cascade Designs brands and products in the Government and Military channels. This includes sales, business development, customer service and new product development. The Sr. Manager will work closely with the Supply Chain, Product Development, Finance, Service and Marketing teams to grow the business in a financially and operationally responsible way.

The ideal candidate for this position has a strong track record of driving successful sales to military and federal agencies, including at least six (6) years of outstanding performance and a track record of exceeding quotas. The ideal candidate has substantial experience selling deployment support gear. They will have previously worked with PEO Soldier, Marine Corps System Command, the Maneuver Center for Excellence, and Natick Labs. Having previous relationships with the Army Mountain School, Northern Warfare Training Center, Marine Corps Mountain Warfare Training, Det KodiakCenter, and the 11th Airborne are important qualifications.

Position Responsibilities
• Work with our existing commercial and military customers to quote and sell current our current product offerings.
• Identify future developmental opportunities; work with internal departments to develop new products and services to meet the needs of the customer.
• Work with our internal product development, manufacturing, outdoor sales and service, and management teams to coordinate sales activities and ensure orders are delivered as per quote and demand.
• Frequent travel to military bases, trade shows, and conferences is required.
• Supervise government website registrations (SAM), RFQ quoting, and respond to RFPs.
• Anticipate, prepare and deliver strategic sales presentations via webinars and in-person meetings, with the highest level of professionalism.
• Gain a strong understanding of our broad collection of products and markets.
• Build valuable relationships with decision-makers within the military and federal government markets.
• Manage existing relationships with our Government & Military consultants, lobbyists and independent sales reps.
• Establish and manage a distribution network for Base Exchange Stores (AAFES, etc.).
• Generate price quotations and business proposals.
• Oversee the order processing and fulfillment process for military sales.
• Coordinate customer service activities.
• Direct sales efforts with Prime Vendors and tactical retailers.
• Negotiate and administer our General Services Administration (GSA) Contracts.
• Maintain relationships with NISH/NIB partners to ensure profitability and strong operational performance.
• Schedule and book travel (air, hotel, car rental, etc.).

Candidate Minimum Qualifications and Desired Characteristics
• Bachelors degree and 6 years of increasingly successful outside field sales experience, including a substantial track record of success in the military and/or federal markets.
• History of strong relationships within the military and/or federal markets.
• Excellent oral and written communication skills with an emphasis on clarity.
• Excellent sales negotiation and closing skills.
• Excellent relationship-building and management skills.
• Detailed knowledge of military/federal procurement rules, regulations, procedures, and rank structure.
• Ability to work with our existing customers to identify and develop ancillary products that we may be uniquely situated to provide to them.
• Strong computer proficiency including Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).
• Military or federal affiliation is a plus but not required (such as military spouse or dependent, DoD civilian, former service member, DoDEA, former federal employee).
• Valid driver’s license and ability to pass a background check. (Security clearance not required.)

Compensation and Benefits Include
• Competitive salary based on skills and experience. The salary range is $125,000 to $150,000, based on candidate qualifications.
• Health/Dental/Vision/Life insurance; premiums shared by company.
• Paid personal time off (for vacation and sick days)
• Paid holidays, maternity, and paternity leave.
• Disability (short and long term) options.
• 401(k) with matching.
• Opportunity for personal and professional growth, advancement, and leadership within an innovative and growing company.

Working Conditions
• Work is performed in an office environment, with periodic assignments in the lab, shop floor, and in the field with military agencies and development partners.
• Frequent domestic and international travel is required.
• Preferred location, Reno, NV or Seattle, WA; remote candidates will be considered.

This is intended to describe the general nature and level of work done by people assigned to this job. It is not intended to provide an exhaustive list of the duties or requirements.
